item.title: Telx Minimizes Latency WIth Colocation Near Carriers
item.description:
For applications sensitive to delays, proximity to service providers is crucial. Regardless of your equipment’s speed, signal propagation sets the minimum latency. This speed is about a millisecond per 186 miles in a vacuum and increases with copper or fiber cables, further compounded by routers and switches. Being directly connected to your provider minimizes this distance. Telx offers a solution. Telx specializes in colocation, connecting customers and providers physically. With 15 strategically located centers in 9 states, they offer proximity to media hubs, cable landings, fiber paths, and exchanges...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/telx-minimizes-latency-with-colocation-near-carriers/

item.title: In May 2015, Digi prepaid customers have the chance to win smartphones, tablets, and cars
item.description:
Source: Digi. Thrane. Digi Telecommunication (Digi) is celebrating its 20th anniversary by giving back to its prepaid customers. Throughout May, Digi will be offering prizes like smartphones, tablets, and even cars. From May 1st to May 31st, customers who top-up their prepaid credit are eligible to win prizes. Every day, 20 smartphones will be given away, with 200 tablets awarded weekly. Two lucky winners will even drive home a Ford Ranger...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/in-may-2015-digi-prepaid-customers-have-the-chance-to-win-smartphones-tablets-and-cars/
